intro: Aldina microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved Aldina, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tubular, two-lipped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
